task.title: How to Make Friends on the Bus
task.shortdesc: You just woke up at a new apartment, and you have no idea where you are. You have to get to campus, but the friend you usually ride with isn't there. The only possible solution is to either ride the bus in miserable and embarrassing silence, or make a friend.

taskbody.context: Virginia Tech contains a plethora of people. You should, statistically, be able to make a new friend every day. Riding the bus from Maple Ridge to campus gives you ample time to forge a connection with strangers. These steps will require you to talk to and interact with strangers.

step.cmd: Stand inside the bus shelter (Figure 1) at the Maple Ridge bus stop.
Place book in backpack and take headphones out of ears. Be as approachable as possible.
Locate another individual who is not looking at their phone while waiting (Figure 2).
Say "Hi, how are you?" and wait for a response.
Continue the conversation by finding a mutual interest.
Sit next to that person on the bus.
